On Escalation Ticket # 00431840 the new comment has been added: Sanjay Meghani:

@Ethan Israel @Michael Burrofato @WaitingOnEngineer

The NEA doesn't refresh the host if the host is updated recently or in a time range that is configured in Settings > Host Inventory > Only refresh inventory items older than. By default, this value is 60 days. 


That means if the host is updated in the last 60 days then it will be skipped and you can see the below message for a few hosts in the log file provided by the customer.

"Host not added because last update is too recent: PSQLA581WLST1 - 1/8/2025 2:42:52 PM"

You can set it lower so the application picks it up.

[DevOps CommentId:11508661]
On Escalation Ticket # 00431840 the new comment has been added: This is happening for newly discovered hosts
On Escalation Ticket # 00431840 the new comment has been added: I was able to replicate this in my lab.  I dropped all host than ran a discovery off the schedule.  Logs attached.

On Escalation Ticket # 00431840 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting R&D.

On Escalation Ticket # 00431840 the new comment has been added: Sanjay Meghani:

@Ethan Israel @Helen Randall @Michael Burrofato @Salesforce

I can reproduce the issue in 11.6 ( the below message) but this is fixed in 12.0 as part of the scheduler refactor ticket. So we need to merge just the fix down to 11.6.

"Host not added because the queue is not active"

[DevOps CommentId:11514406]
